revised_title: Galvanic Currents in the Blood: A Physiological and Pathological Inquiry
tldr: The author investigates the presence of galvanic currents in the blood and their role in the circulatory system. Experiments on animals reveal that a direct current is present, passing from the artery to the vein. The author also explores the significance of these currents in physiological and pathological inquiries, as well as their connection to muscle function and the nervous system.
